item.title: Pavement covered in leaves, 7th October
item.description:
This section of Ashby Road (between Breakspears Road and Wickham Road) is NEVER swept. Leaves and littler constantly build up and make it difficult to walk along the pavement. Please sweep asap going forwards regularly.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ashby Road, New Cross, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping at 10 Thornton Street SW9 6AG, very extensive amount of rubbish., 7th October
item.description:
I like to report a very extensive amount of flytipping at 10 Thornton Street SW9 6AG. The flytipping consists of cardboard doors, bedframe, and bags of rubble. There is unfortunately a vast amount of it. Please could the rubbish be removed. I would say the rubbish has been there approximately a week.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thornton Street, Brixton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dirty streets, 7th October
item.description:
Hayes Way hasn’t been swept in months. The summer fruit seeds are dangerous underfoot when walking on the pavements. The whole of Hayes Way on both sides needs sweeping.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 40A, Hayes Way, Park Langley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loads of rubbish on the pavement., 7th October
item.description:
Rubbish on pavement. There is a skip just off the pavement which is full & now people are leaving rubbish next to it, overflowing everywhere.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kingsmead Avenue, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Top end of Floyd Road, 7th October
item.description:
Yet more fly tipping. As fast as any clearance takes place another lot of rubbish is dumped. RBG never acts to identify the culprits so perhaps the solution is to leave the whole mess to grow and grow until the rats arrive and Floyd Road residents rebel.This area is a disgrace.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 39, Charlton Church Lane, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked street lights, 7th October
item.description:
The lamp posts between 1 & 2 is blocked by over hanging trees there is no light on road between these two as can be seen by photos Need cutting well back not trimmed Thankyou

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Daniel Close, London
Report on FixMyStreet
